articles.content:
Foreign Figures Visit DPRK Embassies 
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign figures visited the DPRK embassies in their countries in the period from Feb. 10 to 16 on the occasion of the February fete.
 They were a delegation of the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea led by General Secretary Sekou Konate, Chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association Diallo, Political Advisor to the Guinean President Dorank Assifat Diasseny who is director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, National Secretary of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria Vincent Ogbulafor, the general president and presidents of three companies of Malaysia including the M.K.P. Company.
 The party delegation and figures of the political and business circles placed floral baskets before portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and made bows.    
 In the meantime, the Malaysian People's Movement sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy on Feb. 16.

articles.title: Greek Party Demands Withdrawal of U.S. Troops and Nukes from S. Korea
No Peace and Reunification without National Independence: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Greek Party Demands Withdrawal of U.S. Troops and Nukes from S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Theses on the situation of Korea, Cuba and other countries was adopted at the 17th Congress of the Communist Party of Greece (CPG) that closed on Feb. 12.
 The theses notes that the DPRK has taken self-defensive measures against the interference of the imperialists and the latter are going on a rampage under this pretext.    
 Recalling that the DPRK established diplomatic ties with Greece and many other countries, the theses calls for the withdrawal of the U.S. troops and nuclear weapons from south Korea and an end to the imperialists' interference in the Korean Peninsula.

Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan 
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met a congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan led by Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, on a visit to the socialist homeland on the occasion of the auspicious February fete and had a talk with it in an atmosphere overflowing with compatriotic feelings at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were officials concerned.
